metadata.titleEn: Remote sensing products of vegetation parameters in key areas of Qilian Mountains (2020)
metadata.titleCn: 祁连山地区重点区域植被参数遥感产品（2020）
metadata.description: The dataset includes the remote sensing products of normalized vegetation index, vegetation coverage, net primary productivity, grassland biomass, forest volume and vegetation parameters of Heihe River Basin from May 2020 to October 2020, with a spatial resolution of 10m. In this data set, gaofen-1, gaofen-6, sentry, ziyuan-3 and other remote sensing data sources are used, combined with meteorological, ground monitoring and other basic data, and vegetation parameter inversion algorithms and models such as band ratio method, mixed pixel decomposition model, CASA model are used to generate monthly vegetation index remote sensing products of Qilian mountain key point region in growing season. This data set provides data support for the diagnosis and dynamic assessment of regional eco-environmental problems by building a high spatial-temporal resolution eco-environmental monitoring data set based on high resolution satellites.
metadata.descriptionCn: 本数据集包括祁连山地区重点区域2020年5月至2020年10月的归一化植被指数、植被覆盖度、植被净初级生产力、草地生物量、森林蓄积量植被参数遥感产品，空间分辨率为10m。本数据集采用高分一号、高分六号、哨兵、资源三号等遥感数据源，结合气象、地面监测等基础数据，采用波段比值法、混合像元分解模型、CASA模型等植被参数反演算法和模型，生成祁连山重点区域生长季逐月植被指数遥感产品。本数据集通过构建以高分卫星为主的高时空分辨率生态环境监测数据集，为区域生态环境问题诊断与生态环境动态评估提供数据支持。
metadata.instructions:
File Naming Convention：NAME_YYYYMM_AREA.tif	
（NAME：NDVI/FVC/NPP/Grassland_Biomass /Forest_Stock，YYYY：year，MM：month，AREA：heihe）
（NDVI：Normalized Difference Vegetation Index；FVC：Fraction Vegetation Cover；NPP：Vegetation Net Primary Productivity；Grassland_Biomass：Grassland Biomass；Forest_Stock：Forest Stock）
Data Version：V1.0
Projection：+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs
Data Format：GeoTIFF，40000 rows×100000 columes
Unit：
NDVI：(-)
FVC：(%)
NPP：*100(gC/m2)
Grassland_Biomass：(g/m2)
Forest_Stock：(m3/m2)
Valid Range：
ndvi：-1~1
fvc：0~1
npp：0~140
shengwuliang：0~380
xujiliang：0~0.16
Filled Value：-9999
metadata.instructionsCn:
文件命名约定：NAME_YYYYMM_AREA.tif	
（NAME：NDVI/FVC/NPP/Grassland_Biomass /Forest_Stock，YYYY：年，MM：月，AREA：qilianshan）
（NDVI：归一化植被指数；FVC：植被覆盖度；NPP：植被净初级生产力；Grassland_Biomass：草地生物量；Forest_Stock：森林蓄积量）
数据版本号：V1.0
投影：+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs
数据格式：GeoTIFF，35000行×90000列
单位：
归一化植被指数：(-)
植被覆盖度：(%)
植被净初级生产力：*100(gC/m2)
草地生物量：(g/m2)
森林蓄积量：(m3/m2)
有效值范围：
归一化植被指数：-1~1
植被覆盖度：0~1
植被净初级生产力：0~140
草地生物量：0~380
森林蓄积量：0~0.16
填充值：-9999

background: Human activities seriously threaten the structure and function of ecosystems. Over the last 50 years, 60% of the worldwide ecosystem services degraded as a result of the global population increase and economic growth (Millennium Ecosystem Assessment, 2005). The concept of the Anthropocene, which is a new era dominated by human activities, suggests that human beings are stewards of nature (Waters et al., 2016; Sanderson et al., 2002). Human has dramatically transformed the earth system (Braat and de Groot, 2012). The degradation of grassland, urbanization and conversion of wetlands to farmland caused by mining resource overexploitation, overgrazing and other high-intensity human activities have greatly changed the structure and function of the ecosystem and reduced the service supply (Darvill and Lindo, 2016). Considering the complexity and diversity of human activity, the human footprint index has wide applicability in quantitative evaluation of human activity (Li et al., 2014). Natural factors and human activities are two important driving forces affecting ecosystem services, the former belongs to the scope of macro-control (Song et al., 2015; Schröter et al., 2005), which can be evaluated but can’t be controlled.
research objective: In this study, the human footprint index of Qinghai lake watershed (QHLW) from 2010 to 2018 was calculated. We focused on the relationship between human footprint index and ecosystem services. Through systematic analysis of the impact of human activities on ecosystem services in the QHLW, it can provide data support and scientific basis for scientific calculation of ecosystem services, ecological environmental protection and sustainable development of the watershed.
methods: In this study, the human footprint index of Qinghai lake watershed (QHLW) from 2010 to 2018 was calculated. Subsequently, five ecosystem services including carbon storage, habitat quality, nitrogen and phosphorus load, soil erosion and water yield were simulated and analyzed using the Integrated Valuation of Environmental Services and Tradeoffs (InVEST) model.
dataset: LUCC data in 2010 and 2018, at 30 m resolution, were obtained from the Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM), Enhanced Thematic Mapper (ETM) and Operational Land Imager (OLI) images by human-computer interaction interpretation. The climate data was acquired from the China Meteorological Administration (http://data.cma.cn/). The soil data comes from the Harmonized World Soil Database version 1.2 (HWSD), which was developed by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) and Vienna International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA). The DEM data, at a spatial resolution of 30 m × 30 m was obtained from Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) digital elevation data.
findings: The results show that human activity was increasing in the QHLW from 2010 to 2018, with significant spatial heterogeneity. Nitrogen load, phosphorus load and water yield presented an upward trend from 2010 to 2018. Anthropogenic variables do affect the provisioning of ecosystem services. Nitrogen and phosphorus load increased with the enhancement of human activities. However, carbon storage, habitat quality and soil erosion were decreasing with the increase of human activities. Human activities affected water yield by increasing water consumption and modifying surface permeability.
backgroundCn: 人类活动严重威胁生态系统的结构和功能。在过去的50年里，由于全球人口增长和经济发展，全球60%的生态系统服务遭到退化（千年生态系统评估，2005）。人类主导的新纪元概念——人类世，表明人类是自然的管理者（Waters等，2016；Sanderson等，2002）。人类已经显著改变了地球系统（Braat和de Groot，2012）。由于资源过度开采、过度放牧以及其他高强度人类活动造成的草地退化、城市化和湿地转为农田，极大地改变了生态系统的结构和功能，并减少了服务供给（Darvill和Lindo，2016）。考虑到人类活动的复杂性和多样性，人类足迹指数在定量评估人类活动方面具有广泛的适用性（Li等，2014）。自然因素和人类活动是影响生态系统服务的两个重要驱动力，前者属于宏观控制的范围（Song等，2015；Schröter等，2005），可以评估但无法控制。
research objectiveCn: 在本研究中，计算了2010年至2018年青海湖流域的人类足迹指数。我们重点关注人类足迹指数与生态系统服务之间的关系。通过系统分析人类活动对青海湖流域生态系统服务的影响，可以为生态系统服务的科学计算、生态环境保护和流域的可持续发展提供数据支持和科学依据。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，计算了2010年至2018年青海湖流域的人类足迹指数。随后，利用环境服务与权衡的综合评估（InVEST）模型模拟和分析了包括碳储存、栖息地质量、氮和磷负荷、土壤侵蚀和水产量在内的五种生态系统服务。
datasetCn: 2010年和2018年的LUCC数据以30米分辨率从Landsat主题制图仪（TM）、增强主题制图仪（ETM）和操作土地成像仪（OLI）图像中通过人机交互解译获得。气候数据来自中国气象局（http://data.cma.cn/）。土壤数据来自于由粮农组织（FAO）和维也纳国际应用系统分析研究所（IIASA）开发的和谐世界土壤数据库版本1.2（HWSD）。数字高程模型（DEM）数据以30米×30米的空间分辨率来自于航天飞机雷达地形测量任务（SRTM）数字高程数据。
findingsCn: 结果显示，从2010年到2018年，人类活动在QHLW地区不断增加，并且存在显著的空间异质性。氮负荷、磷负荷和水产出呈现出从2010年到2018年的上升趋势。人类活动变量确实影响生态系统服务的供给。随着人类活动的增强，氮和磷负荷增加。然而，碳储存、栖息地质量和土壤侵蚀随着人类活动的增加而减少。人类活动通过增加水消耗和改变地表渗透性影响水产出。

Verification.QuestionEn: Does the vegetation parameter inversion algorithm include the mixed pixel decomposition model?
Verification.QuestionCn: 植被参数反演算法是否包括混合像元分解模型？

Verification.QuestionEn: Is the spatial resolution of the DEM data used in the Qinghai lake watershed study 30 m?
Verification.QuestionCn: 在青海湖流域研究中使用的DEM数据的空间分辨率是30米吗？

Verification.QuestionEn: Are high-intensity human activities like mining and overgrazing considered in the analysis of ecosystem service impacts?
Verification.QuestionCn: 高强度的人类活动，如采矿和过度放牧，是否在生态系统服务影响的分析中考虑？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which remote sensing data source is more suitable for vegetation parameter retrieval in the Qilian Mountain region, Gaofen satellites, Sentinel, or ZY-3?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 哪个遥感数据源更适合在祁连山地区进行植被参数提取，Gaofen卫星、Sentinel还是ZY-3？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the spatial resolution of vegetation indices in the Qilian Mountain region dataset more detailed at 10 m or 30 m?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在祁连山地区数据集中，植被指数的空间分辨率是10米还是30米更详细？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What data sources are used in remote sensing for vegetation parameter retrieval in ecological monitoring?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在生态监测中，用于植被参数提取的遥感数据源有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Gaofen-1 Gaofen-6 Sentinel ZY-3 meteorological ground monitoring data
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 高分一号 高分六号 哨兵 ZY-3 气象地面监测数据

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where does the integration of ecological models like InVEST play a role in the analysis of ecosystem services?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 生态模型如InVEST在生态系统服务分析中发挥了什么作用？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Simulation and analysis of ecosystem services
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 生态系统服务的模拟与分析

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to assess vegetation parameters in the Qilian Mountains region?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于评估祁连山地区植被参数的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method used to assess vegetation parameters in the Qilian Mountains region involves using high-resolution remote sensing data from satellites like Gaofen-1, Gaofen-6, Sentinel, and Ziyuan-3, combined with meteorological and ground monitoring data, utilizing algorithms such as band ratio method and mixed pixel decomposition model.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于评估祁连山地区植被参数的数据收集方法涉及使用高分辨率遥感数据，来自高分一号、高分六号、哨兵卫星和资源三号，结合气象和地面监测数据，利用带比率法和混合像元分解模型等算法。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a dataset that includes ecosystem service analysis in a watershed affected by human activities?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个包含受人类活动影响的流域生态系统服务分析的数据集的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset for ecosystem service analysis is the LUCC data from 2010 and 2018, obtained from Landsat images, which were used alongside climate data from the China Meteorological Administration, soil data from the Harmonized World Soil Database, and DEM data from the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission to study the Qinghai lake watershed.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个用于生态系统服务分析的数据集是2010年和2018年的LUCC数据，这些数据来自于Landsat影像，结合了来自中国气象局的气候数据、来自协调世界土壤数据库的土壤数据以及来自航天飞机雷达地形测量任务的DEM数据，用于研究青海湖流域。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of the remote sensing products used for vegetation parameter retrieval in the Qilian Mountains region?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在祁连山地区用于植被参数提取的遥感产品的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: normalized vegetation index, vegetation coverage, net primary productivity, grassland biomass, forest stock volume, May to October 2020, spatial resolution of 10 meters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 归一化植被指数、植被覆盖度、净初级生产力、草地生物量、森林蓄积量，2020年5月至10月，空间分辨率为10米。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features define the human footprint index and its impact on ecosystem services in the Qinghai Lake watershed?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 人类足迹指数的特征及其对青海湖流域生态系统服务的影响是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: carbon storage, habitat quality, nitrogen and phosphorus load, soil erosion, water yield, spatial heterogeneity, increasing anthropogenic variables
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 碳储存、栖息地质量、氮和磷负荷、土壤侵蚀、水量、空间异质性、增加的人为变量

Quantification.QuestionEn: Over what period were the vegetation parameters of the Qilian Mountain region collected in 2020?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 2020年祁连山地区的植被参数是在什么时间段内收集的？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the 'human footprint index' and how is it calculated in environmental studies?
Definition.QuestionCn:
“人类足迹指数”是一个用于衡量人类活动对环境影响的指标。它通过评估人类对土地使用、基础设施、人口密度和人类活动的影响来计算。具体来说，人类足迹指数通常考虑以下几个方面：

1. **土地使用**：包括城市化、农业和森林砍伐等对土地的直接影响。
2. **基础设施**：如道路、建筑和其他人造结构对自然环境的占用。
3. **人口密度**：人类居住和活动的集中程度。
4. **人类活动**：包括交通、工业和其他经济活动对生态系统的影响。

通过综合这些因素，人类足迹指数可以提供一个关于人类活动对生态系统影响的量化评估，帮助研究人员和政策制定者理解和管理人类对环境的影响。
Definition.AnswerEn: The human footprint index is a quantitative metric used to evaluate human activity's impact on ecosystems. It involves calculating the extent and intensity of human influence on the environment, often using data like land use and land cover changes over time. In the context provided, it was calculated for the Qinghai lake watershed using LUCC data from 2010 to 2018.
Definition.AnswerCn: 人类足迹指数是一种定量指标，用于评估人类活动对生态系统的影响。它涉及计算人类对环境影响的范围和强度，通常使用土地利用和土地覆盖变化等数据。根据提供的背景信息，该指数是通过使用2010年至2018年的土地利用和土地覆盖变化数据计算的，针对青海湖流域进行分析。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'LUCC data' refer to in environmental datasets?
Definition.QuestionCn: 'LUCC数据'指的是土地利用和土地覆盖变化数据，在环境数据集中用于描述土地利用和覆盖的变化情况。
Definition.AnswerEn: LUCC data refers to Land Use and Cover Change data. It involves information on how land use and vegetation cover have changed over a specific time period. This data can be obtained from satellite imagery such as Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM), Enhanced Thematic Mapper (ETM), and Operational Land Imager (OLI) images.
Definition.AnswerCn: LUCC数据指的是土地利用和覆盖变化数据。它涉及在特定时间段内土地利用和植被覆盖的变化信息。这些数据可以通过卫星影像获取，例如Landsat主题测量仪（TM）、增强主题测量仪（ETM）和操作性土地成像仪（OLI）图像。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the use of high-resolution remote sensing data like those from satellites improve our understanding of vegetation dynamics in key ecological areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 高分辨率遥感数据（如卫星数据）的使用如何改善我们对关键生态区域植被动态的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution remote sensing data allows for detailed monitoring of vegetation parameters such as the normalized vegetation index, vegetation coverage, and net primary productivity. This enables monthly tracking of vegetation changes during the growing season, providing insights into ecological dynamics and helping to diagnose and evaluate regional environmental issues.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率遥感数据的使用允许对植被参数进行详细监测，如归一化植被指数、植被覆盖度和净初级生产力。这使得在生长季节期间能够对植被变化进行每月跟踪，从而提供对生态动态的洞察，并帮助诊断和评估区域环境问题。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What underlying patterns might be revealed by comparing LUCC data over time, and how can these patterns inform conservation strategies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 通过比较LUCC数据随时间的变化，可能揭示出一些潜在的模式，这些模式可以为保护策略提供信息。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Comparing LUCC data over time can reveal changes in land use and cover, highlighting trends such as urbanization, deforestation, or conversion of natural landscapes to agriculture. These patterns can inform conservation strategies by identifying areas of high ecological value or vulnerability, guiding efforts to protect or restore critical habitats and maintain ecosystem services.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 比较LUCC数据随时间的变化可以揭示土地利用和覆盖的变化，突出城市化、森林砍伐或自然景观转变为农业等趋势。这些模式可以通过识别高生态价值或脆弱区域来为保护策略提供信息，从而指导保护或恢复关键栖息地的努力，并维护生态系统服务。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying reasons for using a combination of climate, soil, and elevation data in assessing ecosystem service changes over time?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用气候、土壤和海拔数据的组合来评估生态系统服务随时间变化的潜在原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The use of a combination of climate, soil, and elevation data is essential for assessing ecosystem service changes over time, as these factors significantly influence ecosystem functionality. Climate data provides insights into weather patterns, soil data informs on nutrient and water retention capabilities, and elevation data affects drainage and erosion patterns, collectively enabling a comprehensive evaluation of ecosystem dynamics under changing human and natural influences.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 气候、土壤和海拔数据的结合使用对于评估生态系统服务随时间的变化至关重要，因为这些因素显著影响生态系统的功能。气候数据提供了天气模式的洞察，土壤数据则提供了营养和水分保持能力的信息，而海拔数据影响排水和侵蚀模式，这些因素共同使得在变化的人为和自然影响下对生态系统动态进行全面评估成为可能。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using high-resolution satellite data like those from GF-1 and GF-6 for monitoring vegetation parameters in ecologically sensitive areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率卫星数据（如GF-1和GF-6）监测生态敏感区域的植被参数的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing high-resolution satellite data sources such as GF-1 and GF-6 allows for detailed monitoring of vegetation parameters, providing accurate spatial resolution which is crucial for diagnosing regional ecological issues and dynamically assessing the ecological environment. This enhances the ability to monitor and analyze changes in vegetation cover and productivity over time, supporting effective environmental management and conservation efforts.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用高分辨率卫星数据源如GF-1和GF-6，可以对植被参数进行详细监测，提供准确的空间分辨率，这对于诊断区域生态问题和动态评估生态环境至关重要。这增强了监测和分析植被覆盖和生产力随时间变化的能力，支持有效的环境管理和保护工作。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects of using different remote sensing platforms like Sentinel and ZY-3 on the temporal and spatial resolution of vegetation monitoring products?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用不同遥感平台如Sentinel和ZY-3对植被监测产品的时间分辨率和空间分辨率可能产生的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using different remote sensing platforms like Sentinel and ZY-3 influences the temporal and spatial resolution of vegetation monitoring products by offering diverse datasets with varying revisit times and spatial resolutions. This diversity enables the generation of high temporal resolution products that capture the dynamic nature of vegetation changes during the growing season, thereby improving the ability to monitor ecological changes and assess environmental impacts in detail across the Qilian Mountains region.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用不同的遥感平台，如Sentinel和ZY-3，会影响植被监测产品的时间和空间分辨率，因为它们提供了具有不同重访时间和空间分辨率的多样化数据集。这种多样性使得能够生成高时间分辨率的产品，捕捉生长季节中植被变化的动态特征，从而提高了在祁连山地区监测生态变化和评估环境影响的能力。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to generate remote sensing products for vegetation parameters in the Qilian Mountains region?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在祁连山地区生成植被参数的遥感产品为何重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to provide data support for diagnosing regional ecological environmental issues and for evaluating ecological environmental dynamics, utilizing high temporal and spatial resolution ecological environment monitoring datasets.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是提供数据支持，以诊断区域生态环境问题，并评估生态环境动态，利用高时间和空间分辨率的生态环境监测数据集。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the purpose of calculating the human footprint index in the Qinghai lake watershed from 2010 to 2018?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 计算2010年至2018年青海湖流域的人类足迹指数的目的是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to systematically analyze the impact of human activities on ecosystem services, which offers data support and a scientific basis for calculating ecosystem services and promoting ecological environmental protection and sustainable development in the watershed.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是系统分析人类活动对生态系统服务的影响，为计算生态系统服务提供数据支持和科学依据，促进流域的生态环境保护和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What drives the need to use the Integrated Valuation of Environmental Services and Tradeoffs (InVEST) model in analyzing ecosystem services in the Qinghai lake watershed?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 是什么驱动了在青海湖流域分析生态系统服务时使用综合生态服务与权衡评估（InVEST）模型的需求？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intention is to simulate and analyze five ecosystem services, including carbon storage and water yield, to understand their relationship with human activities, thereby providing insights into the effects of anthropogenic variables on ecosystem services.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目的是模拟和分析五种生态系统服务，包括碳储存和水产出，以了解它们与人类活动的关系，从而提供对人类活动变量对生态系统服务影响的见解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are used to integrate remote sensing data like those from Gaofen satellites with ground-based meteorological data to enhance vegetation parameter retrieval?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于将高分卫星等遥感数据与地面气象数据集成以增强植被参数提取的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for vegetation parameter retrieval in the Qilian Mountain area involve integrating remote sensing data from Gaofen satellites and others, with meteorological and ground monitoring data. Techniques such as band ratio methods, mixed pixel decomposition models, and CASA models are employed to generate high spatial and temporal resolution ecological monitoring products.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在祁连山地区，植被参数获取的数据收集方法涉及整合高分卫星等遥感数据，以及气象和地面监测数据。采用带比值法、混合像元分解模型和CASA模型等技术，生成高空间和时间分辨率的生态监测产品。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can the human footprint index be quantitatively evaluated in relation to ecosystem services using available datasets?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 人类足迹指数如何通过可用数据集定量评估与生态系统服务的关系？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The human footprint index is quantitatively evaluated by analyzing LUCC data and other spatial datasets. The integration with ecosystem service simulations, such as carbon storage, habitat quality, and soil erosion, is achieved using models like InVEST, which incorporates climate, soil, and DEM data to understand the impact of human activities on ecosystem services.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 人类足迹指数通过分析土地利用/覆盖变化（LUCC）数据和其他空间数据集进行定量评估。通过使用如InVEST等模型，将生态系统服务模拟（如碳储存、栖息地质量和土壤侵蚀）进行整合，这些模型结合气候、土壤和数字高程模型（DEM）数据，以理解人类活动对生态系统服务的影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are involved in generating monthly vegetation index products during the growth season for a regional ecological assessment?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在生长季节为区域生态评估生成月度植被指数产品的程序步骤包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Generating monthly vegetation index products involves using remote sensing data sources like Gaofen, Sentinel, and ZY-3, combined with meteorological and ground monitoring data. The process employs algorithms such as band ratio and mixed pixel decomposition, along with models like CASA, to produce high-resolution remote sensing products for ecological assessment.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 生成每月植被指数产品涉及使用遥感数据源，如高分、Sentinel 和 ZY-3，结合气象和地面监测数据。该过程采用带比率和混合像元分解等算法，以及 CASA 等模型，以生成用于生态评估的高分辨率遥感产品。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the creation of high-resolution remote sensing products for vegetation parameters in key regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在关键区域创建高分辨率遥感产品以获取植被参数成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution satellites such as Gaofen-1, Gaofen-6, Sentinel, and ZY-3, combined with meteorological data and ground monitoring, has enabled the creation of high-resolution remote sensing products for vegetation parameters.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率卫星如高分一号、高分六号、哨兵卫星和ZY-3，结合气象数据和地面监测，已经能够创建高分辨率的植被参数遥感产品。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do different remote sensing image interpretation techniques enable precise vegetation parameter retrieval for ecological assessments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 不同的遥感影像解译技术如何实现精确的植被参数提取，以便进行生态评估？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Techniques such as band ratio methods, mixed pixel decomposition models, and CASA models enable precise vegetation parameter retrieval by using remote sensing data to generate monthly vegetation indices for ecological assessments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术如带比率方法、混合像元分解模型和CASA模型通过使用遥感数据生成每月植被指数，从而实现对植被参数的精确提取，以用于生态评估。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What resources or datasets are essential for simulating ecosystem services using models like InVEST in a watershed context?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在流域背景下，使用像InVEST这样的模型模拟生态系统服务所需的基本资源或数据集包括：
Enablement.AnswerEn: Essential resources include LUCC data from Landsat images, climate data from the China Meteorological Administration, soil data from the Harmonized World Soil Database, and DEM data from SRTM, which are used for simulating ecosystem services using models like InVEST.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 基本资源包括来自Landsat影像的LUCC数据、来自中国气象局的气候数据、来自协调世界土壤数据库的土壤数据，以及来自SRTM的DEM数据，这些数据用于通过InVEST等模型模拟生态系统服务。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how remotely sensed data can be used to derive vegetation parameters with high spatial resolution.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何利用遥感数据以高空间分辨率推导植被参数。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The remotely sensed data, such as from Gaofen-1, Gaofen-6, Sentinel, and ZY-3 satellites, are combined with meteorological and ground monitoring data. Algorithms like band ratio methods, mixed pixel decomposition model, and CASA model are used to retrieve vegetation parameters, achieving a high spatial resolution of 10m.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 遥感数据，如来自高分一号、高分六号、哨兵和ZY-3卫星的数据，与气象和地面监测数据相结合。使用带比值方法、混合像元分解模型和CASA模型等算法来提取植被参数，实现了10米的高空间分辨率。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how human activities are quantified to assess their impact on ecosystem services.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何量化人类活动以评估其对生态系统服务的影响。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Human activities are quantified using the human footprint index, which was calculated for Qinghai lake watershed using data from 2010 to 2018. The relationship between this index and ecosystem services was analyzed with the InVEST model to simulate and assess services like carbon storage, habitat quality, and water yield.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 人类活动通过人类足迹指数进行量化，该指数是基于2010年至2018年的数据计算得出的，适用于青海湖流域。利用InVEST模型分析了该指数与生态系统服务之间的关系，以模拟和评估碳储存、栖息地质量和水产量等服务。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the sources and resolution of data required for modeling ecosystem services effectively.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对有效建模生态系统服务所需的数据来源和分辨率感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: For effective modeling of ecosystem services, LUCC data at 30 m resolution from Landsat images, climate data from the China Meteorological Administration, soil data from the HWSD, and DEM data from SRTM at a 30 m resolution were utilized.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了有效建模生态系统服务，利用了来自Landsat影像的30米分辨率土地利用/土地覆盖变化（LUCC）数据、中国气象局的气候数据、HWSD的土壤数据以及来自SRTM的30米分辨率数字高程模型（DEM）数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore and compare different data collection methods applied to measure vegetation parameters using remote sensing technologies in the context of ecological monitoring.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨和比较不同的数据收集方法，这些方法应用于使用遥感技术测量植被参数，以便进行生态监测。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the context of ecological monitoring, remote sensing technologies such as GF-1, GF-6, Sentinel, and ZY-3 satellites are utilized. These technologies are combined with meteorological and ground monitoring data to generate vegetation parameter products using methods like band ratio, mixed pixel decomposition models, and CASA model-based inversion algorithms. These methods provide high spatial resolution data for evaluating ecological environments.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在生态监测的背景下，遥感技术如GF-1、GF-6、Sentinel和ZY-3卫星被广泛应用。这些技术与气象和地面监测数据相结合，利用带比、混合像元分解模型和基于CASA模型的反演算法生成植被参数产品。这些方法提供高空间分辨率的数据，用于评估生态环境。
